prompt: Jan Dhan-Aadhaar-Mobile (JAM) trinity refers to?
answers: Linking of Jan Dhan, Aadhaar, Mobile for direct transfers
explanation: JAM combines Jan Dhan accounts, Aadhaar identification, and Mobile for efficient direct benefit transfers and financial inclusion.

prompt: RBI's Financial Inclusion Index measures?
explanation: RBI Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index) is based on multiple dimensions - access, usage, quality. Base year 2021, annual publication.

prompt: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana offers life cover of Rs 30,000 for accounts opened?
explanation: Life cover of Rs 30,000 under PMJDY was for accounts opened before August 28, 2018. RuPay accident cover Rs 1 lakh continues.

prompt: BC model was formally allowed by RBI in?
explanation: RBI permitted banks to use BCs (Business Correspondents) in 2006 to extend banking in unbanked areas.

prompt: White Label BC can work with?
explanation: White Label BC can serve customers of multiple banks, unlike traditional BC tied to one bank.

prompt: Bank Mitra is another name for?
explanation: Bank Mitra (Friend of Bank) is a term for Business Correspondent or Customer Service Point (CSP) providing last-mile banking.

prompt: No-Frills account was predecessor of?
explanation: No-Frills account was renamed Basic Savings Bank Deposit (BSBD) account. Zero balance, minimal charges.

prompt: PMJDY accounts can be opened with?
explanation: PMJDY accounts can be opened with zero balance. Simplified KYC (Aadhaar, etc.) is acceptable.

prompt: Overdraft facility under PMJDY is available to?
answers: One account per household after 6 months satisfactory operation
explanation: OD up to Rs 5,000 to one account per household, preferably lady of the house, after 6 months of satisfactory operation.

prompt: Priority sector includes?
answers: Agriculture MSME exports education housing weaker sections
explanation: Priority sector: agriculture, MSME, export, education, housing, social infra, weaker sections, etc.

prompt: BC outlet and branch - difference?
answers: BC is agent, branch is full service
explanation: BC outlet provides limited services. Branch provides full banking services.

prompt: Interoperability in BC means?
answers: BC works with one bank only
BC can serve customers of any bank
explanation: Interoperable BC can serve customers of different banks. Enhances reach.

prompt: MUDRA is a?
explanation: MUDRA is set up as refinance institution. It operates under the ambit of SIDBI.

prompt: Financial inclusion means?
answers: Access to affordable financial services for all
explanation: Financial inclusion ensures all individuals and businesses have access to useful, affordable financial products and services.

prompt: Zero Balance Account under PMJDY has?
explanation: PMJDY accounts can be opened with zero balance. No minimum balance requirement.

prompt: RuPay card under PMJDY offers accident insurance of?
explanation: RuPay debit card issued under PMJDY provides Rs 1 lakh accident insurance cover.

prompt: How many PMJDY accounts were opened in first year?
explanation: Within first year of PMJDY launch, over 12 crore accounts were opened.

prompt: Jan Dhan to Jan Suraksha includes?
explanation: Jan Dhan to Jan Suraksha paradigm includes PMJDY, PMSBY, PMJJBY, and APY for social security.

prompt: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana was launched on?
explanation: PMJDY was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on August 28, 2014. It was announced in his Independence Day speech on August 15, 2014.

prompt: Under PMJDY, overdraft facility of up to how much is available?
explanation: PMJDY accounts offer overdraft facility of up to Rs 5,000 (after 6 months of satisfactory operation) to one account per household.

prompt: Accident insurance cover under PMJDY is how much?
explanation: RuPay debit card issued under PMJDY provides accident insurance cover of Rs 1 lakh. Life cover of Rs 30,000 was also added for accounts opened before August 28, 2018.

prompt: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana was launched in?
explanation: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) was launched on April 8, 2015, to provide loans up to Rs 10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises.

prompt: Minimum balance requirement in a Basic Savings Bank Deposit (BSBD) account is?
explanation: BSBD accounts have no minimum balance requirement. They are part of financial inclusion. Banks cannot charge for non-maintenance of minimum balance in BSBD.

prompt: BC model helps in?
answers: Financial inclusion - extending banking to unbanked areas
explanation: Banking Correspondent model extends banking services to remote and rural areas where opening full branches is not viable. It supports financial inclusion.
